page.title: 20LANDERMERE CREEK AND QUAY
page.content: LANDERMERE CREEK AND BEAUMONT CUT ARE PART OF THE BACKWATERS BETWEEN WALTON-ON-THE-NAZE AND HARWICH. PART OF THE SEA WALL GOES ROUND THEM BOTH. LANDERMERE WAS ONCE A THRIVING PORT WITH A SMALL SETTLEMENT OF HOUSES AND A PUB,THE KING'S HEAD, WHICH LATER BECAME A DWELLING HOUSE. BEAUMONT QUAY WAS SAID TO BE USED BY SMUGGLERS BUT HAS SINCE FALLEN INTO DISUSE. LANDERMERE QUAY IS SOMETIMES USED BY LOCAL SAILORS AND CANOISTS. THE OLD COTTAGES ARE INHABITED, BEING POPULAR WITH ARTISTS,AND THERE IS A LARGE HOUSE, LANDERMERE HALL. LOCAL CHILDREN LIKE TO CYCLE OR WALK DOWN TO LANDERMERE TO PLAY AND ANOTHER POPULAR WALK IS DOWN TO BEAUMONT QUAY. MANY SEABIRDS CAN BE SEEN IN THE AREA.
